business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rebound: What should stock market investors do in volatile setup?The S&P BSE Sensex climbed 227.35 points to 77,847.56 by 11:39 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 51.20 points to 23,577.70. Despite the recovery, broader market indices remained in negative territory, reflecting persistent volatility on Dalal Street.

Budget 2025: What is joint taxation for married couples?The ICAI's Budget 2025 proposal for joint taxation of married couples aims to ease financial stress, boost compliance, and modernise India's tax system with higher exemptions and flexible slabs.

They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

PPF 2025: Benefits, interest rates, and other details PPF is a secure, tax-free savings option ideal for risk-averse investors seeking long-term financial growth.

TCS Q3 FY25 results: IT giant announces special dividend. Check detailsThe TCS Board of Directors declared a third interim dividend of Rs 10 per equity share and a special dividend for Q3 FY25.

TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% to Rs 12,380 crore; special dividend announcedTCS Q3 results: TCS's revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 63,973 crore, marking a 5.6% YoY increase (4.5% in constant currency). The operating margin was 24.5%, reflecting a YoY decline of 50 basis points but a sequential improvement of 40 basis points. The net margin for the quarter was 19.4%.
Sensex closes 500 points lower: Key reasons behind market volatility todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 528.28 points to close at 77,620.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 162.45 points to end at 23,526.50.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Yogi Adityanath on mandir-masjid debate: Reclaiming heritage not a bad thingUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, speaking at AajTak's Dharma Sansad event, also slammed claims that the area where Maha Kumbh was being held was waqf property.

Addressing the students during a graduation ceremony of the college, Ashwin said that Hindi is not the national language of India.

Deepika Padukone says L&T 'made it worse' with their defence of 90-hour workweekDeepika Padukone expressed her disapproval of L&T Chairman S N Subrahmanyan's statement, in which he suggested he would prefer his employees to work on Sundays, and also criticised the company's subsequent statement defending his remarks.

Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR, zero visibility hits 270 flights, rain forecastDense fog and biting cold gripped Delhi and parts of North India on Friday, reducing visibility to near zero. The Air Quality Index (AQI) in the national capital has deteriorated to a severe level of 409.

India is the world's second-most overworked country, and such advice raises concerns about the toll on employees' mental and physical health. Actor Deepika Padukone was among those who voiced their concern.

Obama, Trump all smiles during 'friendly' chat, candid moment stirs buzzDespite years of political feuding, former presidents Barack Obama and Donald Trump shook hands and appeared at ease as they sat side by side. They were seen smiling and chuckling during their conversation.

Explained: Delhi voters have always chosen experience over new bloodVoters in Delhi value experience more, as they recognise the importance of having leaders who understand the system and can deliver on their promises. By 2003, the number of first-timers was reduced to 21. The number of candidates winning a second term had increased to 30 from eight in 1993, while 16 candidates secured a third term from merely two in 1993.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
